title: England will finish top of their World Cup group after France clash is called off due
text:
England will finish top of their Rugby World Cup group after their final game against France was cancelled.

The Pool C clash was scheduled for Saturday in Yokohama but was called off with super typhoon Hagabis set to cause havoc.

Due to its cancellation, the match will be recorded as a 0-0 with both teams awarded two points each.

Eddie Jones's England won't have played for two weeks before their quarter-final clash in Oita

England will finish their Rugby World Cup pool top after their match with France was cancelled

That would leave England top of the pool on 17 points with France in second on 15.

It leaves the prospect of a quarter-final tie against Australia, who are second in Pool D behind Wales. The runners-up in Pool D will face the winners of Pool C.

Australia knocked England out of the pool stage of the last World Cup on their way to the final.

This weekend's cancellation also means that England won't have played for two weeks ahead of their last eight-tie in Oita.

England currently top Pool C, and would stay there if the game is recorded as a 0-0 draw

Typhoon Hagibis is being put on par with a category 5 hurricane with 160mph winds expected

England's last match was last Saturday and ended in a comfortable victory over Argentina in Chofu.

World Rugby will hold a press conference on Thursday where an explanation will be given.

There was a possibility that England's match against France would be moved to Oita but that wasn't logistically possible.
description: England will finish top of their Rugby World Cup group after their final game against France was cancelled. They are likely to face Australia in the quarter-finals in Oita on October 19.
